page.title: 01Oldmeldrum and the Garioch
page.content: Oldmeldrum, with a population of 1700, dominates the north West. Within commuting distance of Aberdeen, housing growth has recently been steady and planning permission granted for further private housing south of the school. More sheltered housing for old folk is meanwhile being constructed. Population consists of many oil related workers and retired members of the farming community. The school has a roll of 220, a government financed nursery and privately run playgroup. Pupils must travel 5 miles to Inverurie for secondary education. Glengarioch Distillery employs 17 workers and produces 1,200,000 litres of alcohol yearly. This was the pilot plant for use of recycled heat and now produces 130tonnes of tomatoes yearly. Mixed farming, mainly crops, in rural area. Contributor: J Milton
